intro.title: SAIS 5-Point Distribution Methodology
intro.description: You will be presented with a series of statements. For each statement, distribute 5 points between the two options based on your level of agreement. The total must always equal 5 points.

instructions.title: Distribution Instructions:
examples: 5-0: Completely agree with the first option, disagree with the second
4-1: Strongly agree with first with slight agreement on second
3-2: Lean more toward first but some truth in second
2-3: Lean more toward second but some truth in first
1-4: Strongly agree with second with slight agreement on first
0-5: Completely agree with the second option, disagree with the first

questions.statement: When I need to recharge my vitality, I tend to:
questions.optionA: Immerse myself in my rich inner world of thoughts and feelings, as if connecting with a deep, calm root center
questions.optionB: Interact with the wide spectrum of activities and people in my external environment, drawing vitality from their interaction

questions.statement: In dialogue aimed at exploring a new idea, my approach is:
questions.optionA: Receive the idea and contemplate it internally first, then share the essence of my insights with focus
questions.optionB: Think out loud and directly interact verbally with others, where my vision forms and clarifies through dialogue dynamics

questions.statement: What I consider my 'real world' from which I derive my existence is:
questions.optionA: My deep internal system of thoughts and feelings, which others cannot see directly but which forms my identity
questions.optionB: The network of tangible events, interactions and activities that I participate in with others in my environment

questions.statement: When dealing with the world around me, I prefer:
questions.optionA: Diving into the sea of possibilities and hidden meanings, using the 'third eye' insight to see beyond the familiar
questions.optionB: Interacting with tangible physical reality, relying on my five senses to gather precise and solid facts

questions.statement: When starting a new project, what excites me first is:
questions.optionA: The overall vision and unlimited possibilities that could emerge from the project
questions.optionB: The available facts and clear practical steps that can be taken here and now

questions.optionA: Abstract concepts and theories that explain 'why' and 'how' the universe works
questions.optionB: Tangible facts and physical details that describe 'what is' actually present

questions.statement: When making a decision that affects others, I primarily rely on:
questions.optionA: Logical and objective analysis of facts, as if building a coherent mental structure ensuring fairness and efficiency
questions.optionB: My inner value compass and harmony with others' feelings, connecting to the 'heart' center to ensure harmony and mutual understanding

questions.statement: How do I reach my firm conclusions and convictions?
questions.optionA: Through a logical path and precise analysis of data, step by step, reaching an inevitable and proven conclusion
questions.optionB: Through what I feel and believe based on my value system and deep life experiences with people

questions.statement: The image I'm comfortable having people reflect about me is:
questions.optionA: Someone capable of deep analysis and making decisions based on reason and logic
questions.optionB: Someone capable of feeling for others and understanding their motivations and human values

questions.statement: In managing my tasks and responsibilities, I prefer:
questions.optionA: Establishing a clear time structure and system to follow, creating a sense of control and predictability
questions.optionB: Leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity, allowing options to remain open as long as possible

questions.statement: When making an important decision, my approach is:
questions.optionA: Gather necessary information, analyze it quickly, then make a decisive decision to move forward
questions.optionB: Explore all angles and potential options, keeping the door open for more information before committing to one path

questions.statement: My preferred lifestyle is one that allows me:
questions.optionA: The ability to predict and know what is expected of me in advance, giving me a sense of stability
questions.optionB: Freedom to change and explore new and surprising paths, keeping my vitality renewed
